I'm here at Grand on behalf of why from here I'm resuming my journey across the country sharing with good stories of our fellow Americans this week I was lucky enough to experience the iconic New York
City there's something magical about fall in Manhattan It's that sweet spot between the summer humidity and the icy winter when you can actually walk around town
Feel good and things don't smell so bad
It was late afternoon when I checked into my hotel and dropped off my bag [noise] New York is a great walking city and nothing encourages that more than a hotel room the size of a pine cone [noise]
The streets were colorful as always and Halloween has hit the city have you ever complimented someone's costume and realized he was just a New Yorker wears a milk carton
As a hat [noise] I have
[noise]
Walked into Washington Square park and sat on a bench near a dog run there is nothing crazier than in New York dog park
These are not dogs that are used to the freedom of backyards and rolling hills these are pets that have been locked indoors for hours drinking coffee trying not to be on the New York post
When they finally get to the dog park they lose their minds
I sat next to one of the dog owners musician named Dave even though he was in sweat pants has long hair and cool Jean jacket said he was a rocker his dog look cool to he was a mutt named Rocco
With a spike collar and an upper lip and permanent snarl
David lived in the village with Rocco his whole adult life and makes a living now is a studio musician he was lamenting about how the city's changed
There's no scene for the young bands any more so than New York used to be a city of artists weirdos who were too strange to live in their hometowns but now there's nothing left at the weirdos can afford he said the one thing that will never change is the amazing diversity in the city there are people from
Just look at this dog park Rocco just a crazy mud and here he is hanging with three pug a purebred German Shepherd and the French poodle who's getting a little too friendly with or knows this is New York
After meeting some friends for dinner I headed back towards the hotel through the west village on a normal night's this area's hopping but as Halloween comes near it's truly outrageous the bars were in full force and people were dressed up in costumes roaming the streets
To me it's the adults in costume were the scariest part of Halloween
At least when the child dresses up like a ninja turtle chances are he won't be drunk and hitting on your girlfriend
